issue.title: FCD Ballot Comment GB-76
issue.discussion:
The C++0x FCD recommends, in a note (see 19.5.1.1/1), that users create a single error category object for each user defined error category and specifies error_category equality comparsions based on equality of addresses (19.5.1.3). The Draft apparently ignores this when specifying standard error category objects in section 19.5.1.5, by allowing the generic_category() and system_category() functions to return distinct objects for each invocation.
Resolved in Rapperswil by a motion to directly apply the words from the ballot comment in N3102.
issue.resolution: Append a new sentence to 19.5.1.5 [syserr.errcat.objects]/1, which reads "All calls of this function return references to the same object.", and append the same sentence to 19.5.1.5/3.
